Name: Aldarian Gauntlet
Comment: A rare artifact. This battle-worn gauntlet shows heavy use.

Name: Aldarian Sword
Comment: An uncommon artifact. A worn military sword, likely from the War of the Lilies.

Name: Aldarian War Banner
Comment: A rare artifact. Emblazoned with the royal crest of Aldaria.

Name: Family Crest Pendant
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Once widely adopted in Aldaria, pendants were given to family members who were leaving home for the first time.

Name: Lost Crown of Aldaria
Comment: A legendary artifact. Could this be the crown that was lost after the Caldosian Empire's invasion?

Name: Caldosian Breastplate
Comment: A rare artifact. This magnificent breastplate is so ornate, it was likely used for ceremonial purposes.

Name: Caldosian Drinking Horn
Comment: A rare artifact. Drinking horns were usually passed down through the family line.

Name: Caldosian Emperor Bust
Comment: An uncommon artifact. The bust of a Caldosian Emperor. It's not clear which one.

Name: Caldosian Sword
Comment: An uncommon artifact. An imperial officer's sword from the early days of the Caldosian Empire.

Name: Statuette of Caldarus
Comment: A legendary artifact. There seems to have been a subset of the empire that once worshiped Caldarus...

Name: Alda Bronze Sword
Comment: A rare artifact. Its intricate carvings and blue-green patina give this sword an otherworldly appearance.

Name: Alda Clay Pot
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Made from rich river clay, a faded pattern can still be seen. Once used by the Alda people to store food.

Name: Alda Feather Pendant
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Once used in marriage proposals, beautifully designed.

Name: Alda Gem Bracelet
Comment: A legendary artifact. Non-local gems suggest the Alda had trading partners across the sea.

Name: Alda Mural Tablet
Comment: A rare artifact. Depicts a scene of the Mistrian coast, as seen hundreds of years ago.

Name: Ancient Crystal Goblet
Comment: A rare artifact. Elegant and sturdy, this goblet was likely used during Witch Queen rituals.

Name: Ancient Gold Coin
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Etched with the outline of the Witch Queen on one side, and a magnificent tower on the other.

Name: Ancient Horn Circlet
Comment: A rare artifact. A horn circlet from the age of the Witch Queens. Was this a fashion accessory or did it serve a greater purpose?

Name: Ancient Royal Scepter
Comment: A legendary artifact. A Royal Scepter with the head of a dragon. The symbol of the Witch Queen's authority.

Name: Ancient Stone Lantern
Comment: An uncommon artifact. An impossibly delicate stone lantern from the age of the Witch Queens. It still retains an ethereal glow from within.

Name: Amber Trapped Insect
Comment: An uncommon artifact. It's noticeably bigger than today's insects.

Name: Fossilized Egg
Comment: A rare artifact. What could be inside?

Name: Meteorite
Comment: A legendary artifact. There's no telling how long ago it fell...

Name: Tiny Dinosaur Skeleton
Comment: A rare artifact. Definitely not just a lizard.

Name: Trilobite Fossil
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Too many legs, but still kinda cute.

Name: Black Tablet
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Made of a strange metal, it's not clear what this is for.

Name: Completely Wrong Map
Comment: An uncommon artifact. A badly faded map that appears to show a landmass where the Western Bay now lies.

Name: Muttering Cube
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This device emits a low hiss most of the time, and occasionally what sounds like voices from far away.

Name: Unknown Dragon Statuette
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This doesn't appear to be Caldarus.

Name: Weightless Stone
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This black stone appears otherworldly in origin. It has no weight, and will roll around from the slightest breeze.

Name: Coin Lump
Location: Found whilst fishing (requires Aquatic Antiquities Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. A mass of old coins, fused together by time.

Name: Giant Fish Scale
Location: Found whilst fishing (requires Aquatic Antiquities Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Can't imagine what fish this came from.

Name: Rubber Fish
Location: Found whilst fishing (requires Aquatic Antiquities Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. How did this get in the water in the first place?

Name: Rusted Treasure Chest
Location: Found whilst fishing (requires Aquatic Antiquities Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Looks quite valuable, a shame it can't be opened.

Name: Water Sphere
Location: Found whilst fishing (requires Aquatic Antiquities Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. You're not sure why, but it won't pop.

Name: Criminal Confession
Location: Found whilst Diving (requires Sunken Secrets Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Too bad the pages are fused together.

Name: Mermaid's Comb
Location: Found whilst Diving (requires Sunken Secrets Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Looks suspiciously like a fork.

Name: Rainbow Seaweed
Location: Found whilst Diving (requires Sunken Secrets Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Can only be found floating in the current, no one seems to know where it grows.

Name: Rock with a Hole
Location: Found whilst Diving (requires Sunken Secrets Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Seems to be naturally formed.

Name: Rusted Shield
Location: Found whilst Diving (requires Sunken Secrets Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. A very old shield with an unusual design.

Name: Diamond-backed Mirror
Comment: A rare artifact. The use of diamond here feels impractical.

Name: Flint Arrowhead
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Likely lost during a hunt.

Name: Obsidian Blade
Comment: A rare artifact. The artifact is still dangerously sharp.

Name: Shortcut Scroll
Comment: A legendary artifact. The scroll appears to show a quick and easy route to the bottom of the Mines, but you don't recognize any of the paths.

Name: Stone Horse
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Carefully carved and very cute.

Name: Miner's Helmet
Comment: A rare artifact. There is a worn away name on it that ends with the letter L...

Name: Miner's Pickaxe
Comment: A common artifact. It's in pretty good condition despite its age.

Name: Miner's Rucksack
Comment: An uncommon artifact. It seems to have been down in the Mines a long time.

Name: Miner's Slab
Comment: An uncommon artifact. It appears to warn of pitfalls ahead.

Name: Tin Lunchbox
Comment: A common artifact. Sadly, it's empty.

Name: Crab Statue
Comment: A rare artifact. This delicately crafted statue seems almost alive.

Name: Dense Water
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This water is so dense that it holds its shape even in air.

Name: Starlight Coral
Comment: A common artifact. This piece of coal glimmers as if reflecting starlight.

Name: Stone Shell
Comment: A common artifact. When you hold it to your ear, you can hear the sound of water flowing through deep caves.

Name: Tidestone
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This chunk of stone appears to grow and shrink slightly along with the tides.

Name: Earth-infused Stone
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This chunk of rock has taken on elemental qualities of earth.

Name: Faceted Rock Gem
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Despite its mesmerizing, gem-like appearance, it's just a piece of rock.

Name: Really Round Rock
Comment: A common artifact. This naturally formed stone is unnaturally round.

Name: Rock Statue
Comment: A rare artifact. This naturally formed stone appears to be in the shape of a human, but... surely it's just a coincidence.

Name: Seriously Square Stone
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This naturally formed stone is a perfect square, a true delight for a rock connoisseur.

Name: Ritual Beads
Location: Ritual Chambers (requires Lost to History Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. Running these beads through your hand evokes a feeling of serenity.

Name: Ritual Chalice
Location: Ritual Chambers (requires Lost to History Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This ornate chalice was presumably used during ancient rituals.

Name: Ritual Incense Burner
Location: Ritual Chambers (requires Lost to History Skill)
Comment: An uncommon artifact. The faint scent of incense still clings to this ancient burner.

Name: Ritual Scepter
Location: Ritual Chambers (requires Lost to History Skill)
Comment: A rare artifact. This ritual scepter was likely used by Dragon Priestesses during rituals.

Name: Ritual Tablet
Location: Ritual Chambers (requires Lost to History Skill)
Comment: A rare artifact. This tablet has a series of pictographs that show how to perform a ritual. It appears that one of the figures is a dragon.

Name: Vintage Brush
Comment: A rare artifact. This cute vintage tool was used to pet farm animals in years past.

Name: Vintage Cow Bell
Comment: A legendary artifact. This vintage bell would have been used to call cows home in bygone years.

Name: Vintage Hammer
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This vintage wooden hammer was used to break rocks before pickaxes were commonplace.

Name: Vintage Sickle
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This vintage sickle was used by past generations to turn grass into fodder.

Name: Vintage Watering Can
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This vintage watering can was popular among farmers back in the day.

Name: Perfect Copper Ore
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This large chunk of pure copper ore is worthy of display.

Name: Perfect Iron Ore
Comment: An uncommon artifact. This chunk of iron is too magnificent to simply melt down.

Name: Perfect Silver Ore
Comment: An uncommon artifact. The size and sheen on this piece of silver is a work of art.

Name: Perfect Gold Ore
Comment: A rare artifact. This gold ore is incredibly large and splendid.

Name: Perfect Mistril Ore
Comment: A rare artifact. This mistril ore is incredibly large and splendid.

Name: Perfect Ruby
Comment: A rare artifact. This ruby is incredibly large and splendid.

Name: Perfect Sapphire
Comment: A rare artifact. This unusually large sapphire seems to glow from within.

Name: Perfect Emerald
Comment: An uncommon artifact. An emerald of this clarity would gain nothing from being worked further.

Name: Perfect Diamond
Comment: A rare artifact. This diamond is incredibly large and splendid.

Name: Perfect Pink Diamond
Comment: A rare artifact. This pink diamond is incredibly large and splendid.

Name: Clay
Location: Mining, Diving, Balor's Wagon for 50, Carpenter for 50
Comment: A small lump of clay. Used in a variety of crafting recipes.

Name: Peat
Location: Mining, Carpenter for 50 (requires Steady Supplies Skill)
Comment: A brick of compressed organic matter, commonly burned as fuel. Used as a crafting material.

Name: Shard Mass
Comment: A large mass of shards originating from unknown artifacts. Used as a crafting material.

Name: Shards
Comment: Shards originating from unknown artifacts. Used as a crafting material.

Name: Sod
Location: Archaeology, Mining, Carpenter for 50 (requires Steady Supplies Skill)
Comment: A square of cut earth. Used as a crafting material.
